scenes.concept_description: Animated map highlighting ancient Persia (modern Iran) with stylized scrolls and a vibrant spinach leaf unfurling.
scenes.key_takeaway: Spinach originated in ancient Persia (modern-day Iran) over 2,000 years ago!

scenes.concept_description: Animated journey along the Silk Road with charming cartoon trade caravans (camels/boats) carrying spinach leaves towards a stylized ancient Chinese city. Chinese characters appear.
scenes.key_takeaway: It journeyed eastward, reaching China in the 7th century via Nepal, where it was known as 'Persian vegetable.'

scenes.concept_description: An animated map showing the Moors introducing spinach to Spain in the 11th century. A medieval Spanish castle and a noble's feast table with spinach dishes appear.
scenes.key_takeaway: The Moors introduced spinach to Spain in the 11th century, from where it slowly spread across Europe.

scenes.concept_description: A whimsical animation of Catherine de' Medici enjoying a spinach dish in Renaissance Italy. Transitions to a classic Popeye cartoon scene flexing his muscles, then to a modern, vibrant plate of healthy food.
scenes.key_takeaway: Popularized in Renaissance Italy by Catherine de' Medici and cemented as a health powerhouse by Popeye in the 20th century!
